Package shared

Interface Iserver

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
ServerImpl
public interface Iserver
extends java.rmi.Remote
Interface of the ServerImpl object, used by RMI
Version:
1.0
Author:
vincent acila

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int checks_user​(java.lang.String pseudo)
    Checks if the user already exists in the database with the given pseudo
    void clientQuit​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient client)
    Removes the client from a game
    void disconnect​(iClient client)
    Disconnect a client : delete the token in the database.
    int isAGoodMove​(int source, int destination, java.lang.String GMId, iClient client)
    Tests if the move wanted by the client is valid
    int isGameOver​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient client)
    Tests if one the players won the game

    Allows to a player to join a duel create by an other player

    Load a game previously saved

    Create a duel for a player, against the opponent player specified.
    java.lang.String startMatchMaking​(iClient client)
    Initialize a new game if there is no player in standby or add the player to an existing game.

  • Method Details

    • login

      java.lang.String login​(iClient client, java.lang.String password) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.sql.SQLException
      According to the given credentials, tries to login the player
      Parameters:
      client - the client requesting to connect
      password - the password used to identify the client
      Returns:
      the token's session or '0' if the identification failed
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.sql.SQLException - raised if the database cannot be requested

    • disconnect

      void disconnect​(iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.sql.SQLException
      Disconnect a client : delete the token in the database.
      Parameters:
      client - the client who wants quit
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException
      java.sql.SQLException

    • startMatchMaking

      java.lang.String startMatchMaking​(iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Initialize a new game if there is no player in standby or add the player to an existing game.
      Parameters:
      player - who launched a game
      Returns:
      GameManagerID (String) that refers to the GM joined or the GM created.
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException

    • startDuel

      java.lang.String startDuel​(iClient client, java.lang.String opponentPlayer) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Create a duel for a player, against the opponent player specified. It's create a new game manager puts in a special queue, waiting for the opponent player.
      Parameters:
      player -
      opponentPlayer -
      Returns:
      GameManager ID
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException

    • joinDuel

      java.lang.String joinDuel​(iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Allows to a player to join a duel create by an other player
      Parameters:
      player -
      Returns:
      GameManager ID or null if there is no game available
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException

    • checks_user

      int checks_user​(java.lang.String pseudo) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.rmi.RemoteException
      Checks if the user already exists in the database with the given pseudo
      Parameters:
      pseudo -
      Returns:
      1 for true or 0 for false
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.rmi.RemoteException

    • register

      int register​(java.lang.String pseudo, java.lang.String password) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.sql.SQLException
      Create a new user in the database
      Parameters:
      pseudo -
      password -
      Returns:
      1 : the user is created 0 : Error occurred
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException
      java.sql.SQLException

    • playMove

      int playMove​(int source, int destination, java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Allows the client to play a move
      Parameters:
      source - the source cell of the move
      destination - the destination cell of the move
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Returns:
      An information code. -1 : It doesn't belong to the player to play. x : The code returned by GameManager.playMove()
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • isGameOver

      int isGameOver​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Tests if one the players won the game
      Parameters:
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Returns:
      An information code. -1 : the game is still running 0 : the client who sent the request won 1 : the client who sent the request loose
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • isAGoodMove

      int isAGoodMove​(int source, int destination, java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Tests if the move wanted by the client is valid
      Parameters:
      source - the source cell of the move
      destination - the destination cell of the move
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Returns:
      An information code. -1 : It doesn't belong to the player to play. 0 : The move is valid 1 : The move is unvalid
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • minimumPlayersAreConnected

      boolean minimumPlayersAreConnected​(java.lang.String GMId) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Tests if the number of players is enough to be able to play
      Parameters:
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      Returns:
      true or false
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • save

      void save​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Requests the server to save the game
      Parameters:
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • sendMessage

      void sendMessage​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient sender, java.lang.String msg, boolean systemMessage) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Allows the client, or the system, to send a message to all the other players
      Parameters:
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      send - the client sending the request
      msg - the message to send
      systemMessage - switch telling if the message comes from a player or from the server
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • clientQuit

      void clientQuit​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Removes the client from a game
      Parameters:
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • load

      java.lang.String load​(iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException
      Load a game previously saved
      Parameters:
      client - the client loading the game
      Returns:
      true if the gale has been loaded correctly
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
